column1: Conversation

I like this ER and not interested in AH reaction. The comments and the tone are positives. Frankly that is a nice surprise, and appreciate these strong numbers, especially after a less upbeat ER from Facebook. « Sales from the company’s cloud division rose to $4.99 billion, missing Wall Street expectations of $5.04 billion. While the unit has gained some market share under Thomas Kurian, it still lags far behind leaders Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Corp.“It was modestly off of the street’s estimate, but we feel very good with the momentum,” Porat said on a call with reporters. “We are very pleased with the ongoing progress across the board, the product innovation, the buildout of our teams and the strength across verticals.”Alphabet also repurchased $12.6 billion in shares last quarter, and said it had added nearly 18,000 full-time staff during the period, up to 150,028. »

According to Ruth the apple.changes won't have a significant impact since google been working on that for a while in advance.Google services and cloud will be the area of focus in Q4, bigger than usual expenses in capex mainly for servers and infrastructure.As for the Google play fee cut won't have meaningfull impact.One thing that caught my attention was the expected ramp up in hardware sales (Fitbit and pixel 6 phone mainly)and YouTube subscriptions for Q4(Xmas)
Sundar Pinchai is a great under-the-radar CEO..the results speak for themselves
Now Alphabet $GOOGL will have to front run $FB for $VUZI Augmented Reality.
Looks like GOOGL is the best pick among FAAMG. It's the cheapest with a forward PE of only 26, not to mention that Waymo is about to come online. Not surprised to see 3000 very soon. JMHO

If supply chain issues are *allegedly* supposed to plague Google going forward, why was UPS and Ebay up so much on Friday? And why didn't other companies who produce physical goods drop as well? I'm starting to think this was just FUD being spread by the financial news complex to scare us out of our shares and calls.

I've been constantly surprised at how GOOG seems to be ignored by talking heads and the so-called analysts in the mainstream media (including Bloomberg, which I regret subscribing to this year). It seems those people have a hard time understanding the persistent monetization power of a transformative, scalable business model. On top of that, they are pretty much at a loss about a firm not producing tangible goods but influencing people's daily lives with free apps.Congrats to wise, long-term investors who know that the 2nd wave of digital transformation (i.e., AI on the edge) is just beginning.

This week learned us that Google is not Snap, nor is it Apple, Amazon, Facebook, ...Google (Alphabet) is Google, navigating its own course with an endless amount of assets (to name a few: Google, Youtube, Music, AI, cloud, Waymo, SpaceX shares, ...).Waymo alone has the potential to become the "Android" of the selfdriving market.Let's see what the future brings to Google and what Google brings to the future...
GOOG is catching its breathe from yesterday.....$3000+ coming very very soon....
Amazon & Apple badly missing should be a strong indicator of just how great Google’s quarter was.

Highest target $3660===no downgrades, all upgrades,...Aggressively buy any weakness!Monness Crespi analyst Brian White raised the firm's price target on Alphabet to $3,660 from $3,500 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The company's Q3 results were "enviable," with the company managing to sidestep the digital ad pitfalls experienced by leading social media platforms, White tells investors in a research note. While the analyst believes Alphabet is well-positioned to capitalize on the strong secular trend to digital advertising and experience further momentum in the cloud, he expects that the digital ad market will remain volatile in the near-term and antitrust investigations will carry on.

Alphabet still has a very bright future ahead with continued growth from YouTube, Google Cloud, and digital shopping experiences leading the way."

Google posted its highest sales growth in more than a decade and nearly doubled its profit in Q3

Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG) reported quarterly earnings of $27.99 per share which beat the analyst consensus estimate of $23.47 by 19.26 percent. This is a 70.67 percent increase over earnings of $16.40 per share from the same period last year. The company reported quarterly sales of $65.12 billion which beat the analyst consensus estimate of $63.45 billion by 2.63 percent. This is a 41.03 percent increase over sales of $46.17 billion the same period last year.
Ignore Mr. Market. Great quarter, great company. The perfect long term hold.

The stock consolidated from mid Aug to mid November....technicals are now all aligned for an extended run into low $3000's... most likely $3200 before consolidating again....big, big problem here for shorts..MACD / RSI with plenty of room to the upside....today's move has pushed the MACD just over the zero line and the RSI is only sitting at 61 ...and that is with today's action....the pps has broken above the 50 day MA for the first time in almost a month ..all very bullish...look for a follow on day tomorrow of another 2%-3% and a break and hold over $3000 by Thanksgiving....it's all good

From TD Ameritrade News Stream, published 10/22/21 07:03PM:Earnings: Analysts on average expect Google to report earnings of 23.73 a share, up from 16.40 a share a year ago. They were expecting 20.05 a share at the end of June.Above is quoted verbatim from Jon Swarts on the TD Ameritrade News Feed. TD Ameritrade is awesome and I'd suggest anyone use it as their trading platform and news source! Unquoted Commentary:Further reading suggests Google will not be hit hard by Apple's privacy settings. As Google has made adjustments and uses a different technology than Snap. Possible headwinds to consider are a potential for lackluster holiday spending and potential anti-trust issues pushed by the US Senate. Where Google has already, willingly decreased app store cost to developers making its digital store more accessible to developers.Thank you TD Ameritrade and Jon Swartz for the awesome write up heading into earnings next week!
